body.p: To his Excellency the Governor of Kentucky.

Your petitioner Saml O Berry respectfully represents that at the Feby Term 1859 of the Fayette Circuit Court he was fined $250 on an indictment for a disorderly house -- He states that at the time said fine was rendered there was a strong prejudice against the keepers of groceries in the City of Lexington which induced juries upon presumption alone to render verdicts against all who were indicted. He is & has always been a quiet & orderly citizen & denies that he ever suffered or permitted any noise or disorder of any kind about said store -- He has not been in the grocery business for some time, is in poor circumstances & has not the means to pay said fine -- Unless remitted by your Excellency he must go to the jail of the county to satisfy the capias --
He respectfully asks a remission of said fine --
Knowing Saml O Berry to be a peacable -- quiet & well behaved citizen, we recommend to his Excellency the Governor a remission of his fines & unite with him in his petition

John B Payne Jr
Bryan H Allen
Frank. Walters
B F Graves
James B Beck
L. P. Young
Robt J Breckinridge
W, C, May
C. C. Rogers
